body:
### Problem

Using wezterm on Windows with `config.term = "wezterm"` results in the cursor not correctly switching between block and line in modes, among other typical terminal misconfigurations.

Updating `TERM` to contain `xterm-256color` partially fixes the problem.

Looking in the terminal docs, they describe being able to use a terminfo file to extend Neovims understanding of terminal capabilities, however files under ~/.terminfo are apparently not loaded. I looked in https://github.com/mauke/unibilium/blob/master/uniutil.c#L174 and attempted to set `TERMINFO` and `HOME` to appropriate values, but had no success.

It is unclear how to solve this problem cleanly, it appears the docs do not cover Windows build behaviors.

### Steps to reproduce

winget install wez.wezterm

In ~/.wezterm.lua:
```
local wezterm = require("wezterm")
local config = {}
config = wezterm.config_builder()
config.term = "wezterm"
```

Start nvim. Enter insert mode, observe cursor does not change modes.

Open `help term`, observe references to removed legacy feature `ttybuiltin`.

Open `help startup-terminal`, observe that while there is a description that a terminfo database will be used if available, and Unibilium is the library in use, attempts to install a terminfo database along with setting `HOME`, `TERMINFO` or `TERMINFO_DIRS` fail to load a terminfo to address the problem. There is no further description of the apparent difference in configuration on Windows, nor any way to add to or influence or even use members of the builtin mapping.

### Expected behavior

- A mapping of TERM=wezterm to xterm-256color until there is builtin terminfo for this terminal
- Documentation as to how terminfo can be configured on Windows
- Neovim on Windows running under Wezterm has functional title sets, cursor changes, and so on.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.9.4

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

unknown

### Operating system/version

Windows 11

### Terminal name/version

wezterm 20230712-072601-f4abf8fd

### $TERM environment variable

wezterm

### Installation

repo
title: Missing terminfo documentation or non-functional terminfo loads for Windows builds
